For Companies looking to join SFATA, Smoke Free Alternatives Trade Association 
http://sfata.org
For all Vapers, Business or Consumer, CASAA, The Consumer Advocates for Smoke-free Alternatives
http://casaa.org
This is a free member ship that will keep you up to date with any new bills or calls to action.
H.R 2058: http://cqrcengage.com/casaa/app/write-a-letter?0&engagementId=153933
The FDA Deeming Authority Clarification Act of 2015 (HR 2058), introduced by Representative Tom Cole of Oklahoma, would save the U.S. vapor industry from being decimated by improper regulations by the FDA. This bill would amend the Food, Drug, and Cosmetics Act to change the grandfather date for “deemed tobacco products.” This change would allow for all vapor products currently on the market to remain on the market without being subject to the burdensome (read: prohibitive) pre-market FDA approval application process.
It's imperative that if you are a vaper, and these new regulations will affect you, that you contact your state representatives. You can find their information here:
https://www.usa.gov/elected-officials
Contact your Senator and Representatives (Congress) and educate them. Many of them do not know the severity of these regulations.

episodes.title: Pork Milk
episodes.author: eric tomorrow and mike pilot
episodes.summary: The Mediocre show audience in the ongoing debate of "One meat to rule them all"; team beef has grown strong and has gloated the attributes of milk and cheese to their protein.  Cheese seems to be the trump card of the debates.  Eric Tomorrow, host of the show and champion of team pork, not only asked the question, "How do you know pig milk is gross?".   Eric set out to prove once and for all that pork is the meat to rule them all, follow him on his quest to acquire and taste pig's milk.  His grass roots approach is not to be missed. Eric is not afraid to get dirty and the Mediocre show travels to Utah to get the answers.  Eric visits gourmet, green, sustainable farmers in his quest, nay duty to find the answers.

episodes.title: mediocre 376 (live in salt lake)
episodes.author: eric tomorrow and mike pilot
episodes.summary:
recorded live 3/19/11 at brewvies in salt lake city in front of a live audience.
this is the place where i would normally tell you what we talked about on the show, but i figure this space is better used to tell you about the entire weekend in salt lake. never in my life have i felt so welcomed in a city i had never really been to before. never have i felt more important than i did when visiting salt lake city. no amount of voicemails or emails can ever compare to seeing faces in the crowd, and hearing laughs come back at you. in the nearly 6 years i have been doing this show, nothing has ever compared to all the events in utah this past weekend. and as i always say, without you we wouldn't be doing this, and i mean that more than ever. you people gave us an even bigger drive to succeed, because we can't bear the idea of letting you all down. you are an amazing group of people, and we are so lucky to have you as part of the nation. thank you for everything you do for/to us. and thank you for being such an amazing and caring group of people. i wish we could do that every day.
/eric
now please to be enjoying the live show from SLC we had a great time doing it and i hope you all enjoy it too.
thanks to everyone involved in making this happen. we will have a list and talk more in detail about it next week.

episodes.title: mediocre 336 (prophet margin)
episodes.author: eric tomorrow and mike pilot
episodes.summary:
this is yet another solo mediocre show with eric tomorrow.
the mediocre show's favorite kid ever had surgery on 9/22/10 to have her tonsils removed, and because mike is a great dad, he took the week off from the show to be with her and take care of her. you will all be glad to know she is doing great and feeling much better, because she is a total trooper. that being said, i thought i would make a solo show for you guys to enjoy, or at least endure, so at some point in the future you can tell your grandkids you did in fact listen to every episode of the mediocre show, that is, if you have heard episode 1. there are a few still listening who have, but the vast majority of you have not heard it, and truthfully, you are better off having not heard it.
at any rate, in this installment, eric tackles such hard hitting issues as: amish contractors, the film industry, jeff vice, the word retard, buick vehicles, the SLC listener party. and so on.
please enjoy, and join us at our regular time next week on areciboradio.com

mediocre 98 (open arms)
in the highly anticipated episode 98 of the mediocre show, our heros eric and taylor fight evil and wrongdoing, as they have for the last 97 episodes, however this time, there is a fork in the road. see who gets voted off this week, and who moves on to the semi finals to compete for the title. the title of what you ask? quite frankly i'm not sure, but rest assured, it's exciting, like, you totally have a huge boner just thinking about it. rock solid. people will write sonnets about this majestic beast. perhaps a broadway musical, i can say without a doubt it'll be the new "git er done" every truck stop will stock a shirt with it on there. you won't be able to ignore it, but why would you, it'll change your life, FOR THE BETTER. but yeah, here's the new show. stop thinking about your boner, and grow up.

it's been a few weeks. you know that, we know that, let's get past it.
we had some computer trouble. hardware/software/then hardware again.
it's not as though we took a vacation, in fact it has been more stressful than normal for us. so, it seems as though you survived the time without it, and for that i applaud you.
now, on to the business:
as you can imagine, we had quite a backlog of voicemails. we do our best to wade our way through them. we also had a special guest on the show, by the name of alex, he's a tattoo artist.
also, we had some corrections.
some beautiful singing from the mediocre nation.
some confessions, and believe it or not, that took over 2 hours. so i guess we'll save the love/hates, and trucker buddy for episode 97. which will be coming when taylor gets back from riding his new motorcycle from arizona to portland.
thanks for sticking with us, and we have some exciting announcements coming very soon. but in the meantime you should donate to the show so we can get some new gear and avoid delays like this in the future.
